topics.body: Which cartoon pilots do you thing should have had a fully fledged show?

I might actually have a problem with cursing. 

Seems that when I speak around a group of friends, I always manage to slip in a few f-bombs; most of the time, I don't even think about it until it slips out of my mouth, and it's usually when I'm excited. Now, most of friends aren't the type to care about that sort of thing, but for the ones who do, and just so it doesn't start slipping into my professional vocabulary, maybe I ought to start controlling it. Any tips?
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c69cb063687256fc720600#post_53c69cb063687256fc720600
Well fucking shit; I don't fucking know what the piss to do in such a shitty situation.  I don't mean to sound like a ass or a bastard, but damn bollocks I don't know what the hell it's like to have a bloody swearing problem cause goddamn I don't have a christ on a cracker swearing problem.  Bolderdash.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c69cb063687256fc720600#post_53c69cb063687256fc720600
I think I said this before.
Use swear words with strategy. Using them all the time takes away their worth.
However if you rarely swear, the times when you do will be far more prominent.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c69cb063687256fc720600#post_53c69cb063687256fc720600
Have you ever considered that swearing is a matter of superstition? Think about, we have decided that for whatever reason certain sequences of letters and sounds must not be uttered because those sequences of letters and sounds are inherently hurtful in someway.

Fuck shit cock titties asshole motherfucker cunt.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c6a91d6368721a7cd10100#post_53c6a91d6368721a7cd10100
All obscenities come from cultural baggage, and those words carry some heavy, heavy emotional baggage. My point is more that there is nothing inherently magical about the words in and of themselves, it all comes down to how you use them.

Granted in these cases its hard to think of a way you could use, for example, the word faggot in anything other than a hateful or bigoted way.

"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c6a9a16368721a62d60100#post_53c6a9a16368721a62d60100
Its for having an active account here before ponybooru went read only apparently.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c6aa126368721ad33e0200#post_53c6aa126368721ad33e0200

Why's that?
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c6a91d6368721a7cd10100#post_53c6a91d6368721a7cd10100
From my experience, "faggot" is starting to lose its original meaning in typical conversation (or at least in college student conversation). If curses and slurs were divided into tiers of severity, then it'd be a tier or two above "dumbass" or "asshole." However, whenever the LGBT argument gets brought up the term is still used as a slur, so it's still a concern. 

I only ever hear the other slurs when someone is intending to be racist, so those haven't changed at all.
topics.author: 53c5c4df6368727632970000
